snippet.title: Atari 2600 Solaris in STEREO!
snippet.description:
Recorded from an Atari 2600 Jr. console modified for composite video and stereo audio output -- not emulated! Solaris is one of the most graphically advanced Atari 2600 games ever made, and it becomes even more impressive when you get to hear it in stereo!

This is made possible by the fact that the 2600 has two audio channels, which were originally designed to be played through two built-in speakers -- the cutouts for which are visible on top of the original 6-switch model. But ultimately Atari decided instead to combine the two channels together into mono and run it through the RF modulator to your TV's speaker. You can restore stereo sound with some circuit modification, or you can do it the easy way like me, and buy a pre-modified 2600 on eBay.
